bill_title: establish employees' exemptions from employer-imposed COVID-19 vaccine requirements.

bill_versions.bill_text: An Act to establish employees' exemptions from employer-imposed COVID-19 vaccine requirements. Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of South Dakota: Section 1. That chapter 60-2 be amended with a NEW SECTION: No employee in this state may be required by an employer to receive a COVID-19 vaccination if the employee submits to the employer: (1) A written statement from a physician stating that the COVID-19 vaccination is contraindicated for medical reasons; (2) A signed statement from the person in which the person dissents and objects to receiving a COVID-19 vaccine on religious grounds, which includes moral, ethical, and philosophical beliefs or principles; or (3) A signed statement from the person attesting to the person's immunity by prior COVID-19 infection. This section does not apply to service members of the South Dakota National Guard, who are subject to federal activation pursuant to Title 10 of the United States Code.

action_log.status_text: Withdrawn at the Request of the Prime Sponsor
